net.proteusframework.core.xml

Class XMLFragmentValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.xml.XMLFragmentValidator

  • public class XMLFragmentValidator
extends Object
    Validator utility for xml fragments. Validation is performed by wrapping the content in a tag of your choosing. See the main method for an example.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com), Pat Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) static class  XMLFragmentValidator.SingleChild
      ContentHandler that verifies that the root element has a single child element.

    • Method Detail

      • getNamespaces

        public Collection<String> getNamespaces()
        Get the configured namespaces.
        Returns:
        Collection of namespaces.

      • setNamespaceSchemaLocation

        public void setNamespaceSchemaLocation(String namespace,
                                       String uriRef,
                                       String uriLocation)
        Set a namespace schema location. This is used so that the entity resolver can find the schema definition for a namespace. An example: 
         setNamespaceSchemaLocation("smap", "http://cms.i2rd.com/xsd/simplemap",
  "classpath:/com/i2rd/xml/SimpleMap.xsd");
        Parameters:
        namespace - the namespace. To set the default namespace pass an empty string.
        uriRef - the URI reference.
        uriLocation - the URI location. This is typically a classpath location like "classpath:/com/i2rd/xml/SimpleMap.xsd".

      • setRequireRootElement

        public void setRequireRootElement(boolean flag)
        Set the require root element flag. Defaults to true.
        Parameters:
        flag - the flag.

      • validate

        @Nullable
public Pair<Locator,String> validate(String data)
                                        throws ParserConfigurationException,
                                               SAXException,
                                               IOException
        Validates the fragment and returns null if valid; otherwise a locator and description of the first error are returned.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to validate.
        Returns:
        null or a Locator and description if there is an error.
        Throws:
        ParserConfigurationException - if a parser configuration error occurs.
        IOException - if an error occurs reading the data.
        SAXException - if a parser configuration error occurs.

      • validate

        @Nullable
public Pair<Locator,String> validate(String data,
                                               @Nullable
                                               URI xsd)
                                        throws ParserConfigurationException,
                                               SAXException,
                                               IOException
        Validates the fragment and returns null if valid; otherwise a locator and description of the first error are returned.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to validate.
        xsd - the URI of the schema definition. This is no longer used. Use setNamespaceSchemaLocation(String, String, String). You can safely pass null.
        Returns:
        null or a Locator and description if there is an error.
        Throws:
        ParserConfigurationException - if a parser configuration error occurs.
        IOException - if an error occurs reading the data.
        SAXException - if a parser configuration error occurs.

      • validate2

        public List<Pair<Locator,String>> validate2(String data,
                                            @Nullable
                                            URI xsd)
                                     throws ParserConfigurationException,
                                            SAXException,
                                            IOException
        Validates the fragment and returns null if valid; otherwise a locator and description of the first error are returned.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to validate.
        xsd - the URI of the schema definition. This is no longer used. Use setNamespaceSchemaLocation(String, String, String). You can safely pass null.
        Returns:
        null or a Locator and description if there is an error.
        Throws:
        ParserConfigurationException - if a parser configuration error occurs.
        IOException - if an error occurs reading the data.
        SAXException - if a parser configuration error occurs.
